page.title: 07 TRANSPORT PENWORTHAM BYPASS
page.content: In our area the growth of traffic has led to many problems,(so much so that on Penwortham bridge the amount of traffic was only 10% less than on the M6 at Salmesbury)so the task of building a by-pass began.The by-pass goes from Strand road to Cop lane. 35000 trees and shrubs are planted along the route to landscape the area of the road.The contractors that undertook the building of the bridge over the River Ribble are Harbour and General works(Stevin)Ltd,this was completed in Dec.84 at a cost of 2.2m pounds.The main road was built under a 5.8 million pound contract by Sir Alfred McAlpine& Son Ltd.and Fairclough Civil Engineering Ltd.The by-pass and the bridge were officially opened on the 24th May 1985.
